title: Bug 49195: Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works but prints error message
description: When specifying <Server port='1'> in server.xml, Tomcat can still be stopped properly without any issues but it prints an error message in the catalina.20100427.log file. The message states 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' However, after printing this message, Tomcat stops successfully. It seems that when the service launcher stops Tomcat, the Catalina server is not null.
OB: When using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service, an error message is printed in the catalina.20100427.log file stating 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.'
EB: Even though the error message is printed, Tomcat should still stop properly without any issues.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 
1. Specify <Server port='1'> in the server.xml file. 
2. Start the Tomcat Windows service. 
3. Stop the Tomcat Windows service. 
4. Check the catalina.20100427.log file for the error message.
